Prof. Michael S. Lew is a distinguished scientist in multimedia information search and retrieval at
Leiden University , The Netherlands1. He has published over 7 books and 100 scientific articles in the areas of multimedia search, computer vision, human computer interaction, and information retrieval23. Notably, he was the opening keynote speaker for the 9th International Conference on Visual Information Systems (2007)4, the co-founder of influential conferences such as the International Conference on Image and Video Retrieval5 and the IEEE Workshop on Human Computer Interaction6. He was also a founding member of the international advisory committee for the TRECVID video retrieval evaluation project7. His work is frequently cited in both scientific and popular news sources.
